TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RadioButton extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox implements class System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler
type RadioButton = class inherit CheckBox interface IPostBackDataHandler

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this topic: - [Introduction](#introduction) - [Accessibility](#accessibility) - [Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax) ## Introduction The server control permits you to intersperse the radio buttons in a group with other content in the page. The buttons are grouped logically if they all share the same property. > [!NOTE] > You can use the control to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. Validation server controls are also provided to assess user input. For more information, see [Validation Server Control Syntax](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/96d2c59e-693c-4079-9b53-b3ff0d9e9133). ## Accessibility The markup rendered by default for this control might not conform to accessibility standards such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG) priority 1 guidelines. For details about accessibility support for this control, see [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0). ## Declarative Syntax ``` ``` ## Examples The following code example illustrates how to use the control. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButton Example 2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButton Example 2/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic RadioButton Example 2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButton Example 2/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the group that the radio button belongs to.
Docs.value: The name of the group that the radio button belongs to. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton.GroupName%2A> property to specify a grouping of radio buttons to create a mutually exclusive set of controls. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton.GroupName%2A> property when only one selection is possible from a list of available options.
When this property is set, only one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> in the specified group can be selected at a time.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
## Examples The following code example illustrates how to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton.GroupName%2A> property programmatically.
[!code-aspx-csharp[Classic RadioButton.GroupName Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButton.GroupName Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic RadioButton.GroupName Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic RadioButton.GroupName Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: For a description of this member, see .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton> control is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.Checked%2A> property has changed on postback, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButton.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method raises a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBox.CheckedChanged> event.

Docs.related: RadioButton and RadioButtonList Web Server Controls
